codolympics.description: Team event, teams with at most 3 people.
rules: pen and paper round which is a rolling event  each Team gets 45 mins
Online contest - 1hr.
online contest.

code-relay.description:
Have you ever faced difficulty with debugging, version control and consistency in code?
Try it with three people working on the same problem!
Come relay your work with the team and win exciting prizes
code-relay.tagline: Life is a race, Run & Run
rules: Pen and Paper Round.
Duration: 45 minutes.
Duration: 1 hour.
Online coding round on HackerRank where each team will be given 3 coding questions and each team member will start working on one program.
After every 20 minutes, programs are exchanged within the teammates.
Teams with quality code, win!

code-inverse.description: This is going to be a team event, consisting of two rounds.
code-inverse.tagline: Shift your coding gear to reverse!
rules: Pen and paper based  MCQ round.
This round is going to be a fun based coding round.The candidates will have to apply inverse logics in their code to produced the desired output as fast as they can.

u-n-i.description: Are you passionate about UI designing? Do you love bringing your designs to life? Then U ‘n’ I is ready to challenge your creativity! This event is one of a kind and all you need to win is the love to think, design and create. Well, what are you waiting for, get, set, design!
rules: A number of exciting and creative app scenarios will be presented from which participants can choose one.

For the app scenario of their choice, participants should design the UI of the 
following two pages :
● Home page of the app [Mandatory]
● Any other page that brings out a feature of the app [Example.: Chat page,
Newsfeed, Profile page, etc]
Participants can use only the following software for design:
● Adobe Illustrator
● Adobe Photoshop
Computers with the above mentioned software will be provided at the venue.

quiz.description: Get your minds whirring and your pounce sheets ready, and gear up for the third annual Inventé CSE quiz! Do you think you have what it takes to answer challenging questions about the past, present and future of computer science?
rules: Written Preliminary round (25 questions projected on slide, participants write answers on paper)
Top 6/8 teams in finals

yesqueueluck.description:
If you're one of those people that can handle data, this is for you. Normalise those tables and add them constraints!
Its time to sequelize.
rules: This is a pen-paper round.
30 MCQ questions on DBMS basics.
Time Limit: 40 minutes.
Shortlisted teams move on to round 2.
This involves querying a given database to produce the results demanded.

paper-presentation.description:
Be still when you have nothing to say;when genuine passion moves you,say what you have got to say and say it HOT 
- D.H.Lawrence
 Take an advantage of presenting your paper/research on site to a panel of fellow researchers and academicians in the field of education and research.
paper-presentation.tagline: A paper has the title , A presenter has the people.
paper-presentation.notes: If you have other ideas that fit into the prominent domains of COMPUTER SCIENCE,don’t hesitate to send in your entries as well.
rules: TOPICS:
● Internet of Things and Machine Learning
● Blue Eye Technology
● Cyber Crime and Security
● Artificial Intelligence
● Block Chain Technology
● Augmented and Virtual Reality
The received entries from participants will be evaluated based on the following criterias.
● Innovation
● Scope of the paper
● Plagiarism
● Format of the paper
Those who are shortlisted will receive an email from the organising team by September 1,2019.
The shortlisted participants will be entitled to attend the Innovative Mind event to be held on September 13,2019(tentatively).They must carry the following:
●  Identity Card of each participant in a team
●  Hardcopies of their paper – 2nos
●  Powerpoint of their presentation
Each team will be judged by a panel of experienced academicians and researchers.The decision of the panel is final.

techathlon.description: It’s that time of the year, to have some fun with technical skills. Automata, Networks, OS and 5 other domains where you can get your hands dirty. Lets Techathlon.
rules: Participants must choose 3 domains out of available 8. Each domain will have a question set with 20 MCQs.
Qualified Teams must choose one set from the available three. Each set will have two coding question from 2 different domains.

hackers-asylum.description: People in a group of two can team-up together and participate in this event. You don’t need to have any prior knowledge in cyber security or CTFs to participate. Come with an open mind to learn and explore.
rules: Objective based pen and paper test. The primary topics are going to be networking, forensics, Linux, steganography etc. from security perspective. You can feel free to use internet at this round.

This is going to be a Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge, in which all the teams will be given with a multi stage digital puzzle to solve. Each team will be assigned with 2 systems, one with internet connection can use it to refer any online resource to solve our challenge.

meme-time.description: People in a group of two can team-up together and participate in this event. You don’t need to have any prior knowledge in cyber security or CTFs to participate. Come with an open mind to learn and explore.
rules: Objective based pen and paper test. The primary topics are going to be networking, forensics, Linux, steganography etc. from security perspective. You can feel free to use internet at this round.

This is going to be a Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge, in which all the teams will be given with a multi stage digital puzzle to solve. Each team will be assigned with 2 systems, one with internet connection can use it to refer any online resource to solve our challenge.

paper-presentation.description: 'Everything begins With an Idea' – Earl Nightengale.Are you a group of budding innovators who come up with creative ideas but not provided with a platform to showcase your ideas ?Join us in presenting your ideas at Paper Presentation and getting your ideas recognized which paves way for creating a better tomorrow.
rules: 1. Paper must be original and there must be atleast one person to present the paper.
2. Each team should comprise of atmost 3 people and will get time of 10-12 minutes to present the paper and answer the judges questions.
3. The selection criteria will be decided by the judges and the winners will be announced depending upon the consensus of the jury members.
Last date for submission – 26 th August 2019

androider.venue: Lab and classroom(IT dept and CDC)
androider.tagline: Take our test and try out your chances of getting placed in your dream company
rules: Rules:
Maximum of three members per team
Teams must be from same college
Decision of judges will be final
Round 1: Prelims
▪ Pen and paper test
▪ Duration - 30 minutes maximum
▪ 20 MCQs with negative marking related to Android Application Development
▪ Bonus question to break ties
Round 2: Finals
▪ Duration - 2 hours
▪ Problem statement will be given on the spot, and the teams must develop a suitable app, using Android Studio Judging will be based on UI/UX , efficiency, features and innovation.
● Round 1:
Each individual will be given a set of questions with given directions for the respective question. Both correctness and time taken will be considered as a criteria for going to second round.
● Round 2:
Find the relation between the text and the encrypted text and write a proper code for the same in the stipulated
Rules:
1. Only one person per registration is allowed.
2. First round is pen and paper test. Second round will conducted on PC.
3. 10-15 members will be selected for the next round.
Rules:
1. 3 Per Team.
2. Participants should not use mobile phones during the first round.
3. 2 Computers will be provided for the entire team for the second round.
4. 10 mins will be given for each finalist to explain their product.
5. Decisions of the Event heads are final and should be respected.
Round 1:
● Paper Pen Round consisting of 20 MCQs and 5 Subjective Questions about Web Technologies. Each team be given 1 hour for the same.
Round 2:

● Top 5 teams will be selected for Development round which demands a web app where each team should choose 1 topic of the three given topics on spot. 3 hours will be given to each team and 10 mins to explain their product.
Rules:
● Maximum of 2 members in a team
Round 1:
Preliminary round:
● 40 minutes Pen and Paper Round.
● 5 code Deobfuscation questions + Reverse Coding MCQs.
● Top 10 teams qualify for the final round.
Round 2:
Final Round:
● Code Obfuscation + 1 Reverse Coding Task for each team
Rules:
i)1-2 Per team.
ii)Participants should bring laptops with the preferred tool installed(if possible) for the second round. Else intimate us a week before about the tool required.
iii)Decisions of the event organizers are final and should be respected.
Round 1 (Choicemaker):
This round will consist of MCQs which will be based on statistics,probability and basic techniques related to analytics.
Round 2 (Hulk Smash Of Data):
A dataset will be provided to the participants and they are required to perform a basic analysis of the data. The final output should be close to the expected result.
Rules:
1. Individual contest.
2. Electronic Gadgets are not allowed.
3. Hard copy of a resume is required for final round.
Round 1:
Will be a pen and paper round, comprises of 20 MCQs (Quantitative Aptitude, Programming Logic).
Round 2:
Comprises of one coding question.
Round 3:
Technical interview for the short listed candidates.

data-structures.description: A technical event testing the data structures and algorithms knowledge of participants.
rules: Round 1:
● Pen and paper MCQ round(Programming logic)
● 30 MCQs in 30 mins.
Round 2:Finals
● Data structures and algorithm contest in an online Judge(Hacker Rank)
● 90 minutes round with 3 programming questions.
Rules:
● Maximum of 2 members in a team.
● No tab switching is allowed.
● Use of electronic gadgets such as mobile phones, tablets, pendrives,etc…are not allowed.

data-analytics.description: It's almost 2020! Yes, we still aren't in the stone age to travel in petrol and diesel engine driven vehicles...the time has come to step up to build a sustainable and renewable future for the forthcoming generations. And the next big thing which is happening in and around us is the “Electric Revolution in the Automobile sector”. Yes.... An electric revolution in the automobile sector. Interested? Want to know about it? Here is the best platform to enlighten your minds. Presenting you ​Toyota Kirloskar Motors – the automobile giants who are fast accelerating in the market of Hybrid Vehicles and E- Vehicles. Toyota in association with ​Invente 4.0 is staging a talk on the technological advancements and the technical and industrial aspects required for the field of E-Vehicles and Hybrid Vehicles​ here in SSN College of Engineering. Grab your seats, as this is one opportunity where you can directly come across the Giants in person. Get ready to explore the infinity, be there at the ​Justice Pratap Singh Auditorium​ in ​SSN College of Engineering​. On spot registrations are also available.

gully-cricket.description: The cricket fever is just getting bigger and better this season. This time, it's not the Lord's and Ashes that alone matter, as Invente now gives you the chance for your squad to get some cricketing fun, and of course take home some cash prizes too. So be there, to play and relive our childhood 'BOX CRICKET'. (Don't worry, no: of boundaries don't decide the winner here)
rules: 1. Every team must consist of 5 members each.
2. Two teams will face off with each team playing 5 overs.
3. Winner of the team will get the prize money as well as their registration fee back.

quote-or-quit.description: Estimation for a project is no child's play, but we have the most simplified version for all you beginners out there! Attention to all you bidders, Department of Civil Engineering provides you with a live arena to learn, realize and reflect some important lessons in construction estimation. So be seated in the most important chair of a construction firm, and make the best use of your street-smartness and analytics
quote-or-quit.notes: Participants can form a group of maximum 2 people. Individual participation is also encouraged
rules: •	First round is prelims which consists of 15 questions(10 fill in the blanks and 5 MCQ’s)
•	Winners will move to the 2nd round (Around 3 - 5 teams)
•	Plan of the building will be given for estimation.
•	The first team to finish with closest estimate will be the winner
•	Winning team will be awarded with prizes

arCADe.description: Be it an ordinary apartment building or an amazing structure, Design decides everything. So, we present you the arCADe, an opportunity to groom your ingenious design skills.
arCADe.tagline: Every existing structure was once a design.
rules: • A maximum of two people are allowed in a team.
• Students must bring their college ID-Cards.
• Electronic devices are strictly prohibited inside the venue.
• Paper for rough work shall be provided.
• Decision of the judges will be final.

A total of two rounds will be conducted. In the first round, Participants will be required to replicate a given CAD drawing within the time limit. Qualified participants of the first round will be able to compete in the next round.

In this round, problem statement containing specifications and restrictions will be given to the participants. An independent design in accordance with the given conditions will be required of the participants.

call-of-builders.description: Engineering is the art of modelling materials that have never been made and creating things that has never been thought of in the first place.It’s time for the engineer within you to venture out in the numerous possibilities this field offers!  INVENTE 4.0 offers you a platform to express  your creative thinking , so come & join us at ‘CALL OF BUILDERS’, department of Civil Engineering, SSNCE.
call-of-builders.tagline: practical knowledge seems to be more valuable than theoretical knowledge.
rules: 1. The event consists of two rounds:  a) Questionnaire round  b) Final round
2. Only two participants are allowed in a team.
3. The Questionnaire serves as the preliminary round. Participants will be tested on their knowledge of basic civil engineering. The test comprises multiple choice questions.
4. Based on their scores 15 teams will be selected for the finals.
5. In the finals, teams will be making models of given specifications.
6. All the materials for the event will be provided by us. The model must be made only from given materials as no extra material will be provided.
7. Any model deviating from the mentioned specifications will be eliminated.
8. The models will be tested for loading capacity.
This is a questionnaire round. Questions related to basic civil engineering will be asked. The question type is multiple choice questions.

In round 2, a model of given specifications should be made. Any model deviating from the specified requirements will be eliminated. All the materials required for the event will be provided by us. The structure should be made within the given materials as no extra materials will be provided. The structure will be tested for loading capacity. The structure which holds more load will be declared as winner.

clash-of-claims.description: Department of Civil Engineering presents its flagship 'Engineering debate' event, tailor-made for those who wish to present their perspectives and talk about matters that matter. This event tests your logical thinking ability, technical knowledge, factual accuracy and spontaneity to answer and counter your opponent's question. It is open for all departments.
rules: • Event Type: Both On-spot and Online.
• Maximum no of persons per team: Two.
• Cross College teams (except SSN Students teams) are allowed.
First for affirmative Speaker:  3 minutes (2 minutes protected time + 1 minute open to questioning)
First against affirmative Speaker: 3 minutes
Second for affirmative Speaker: 3 minutes
Second against affirmative Speaker: 3 minutes
Final rebuttal rounds (One from each team) : 2.5 minutes (protected time)
* Debate topics will be disclosed 30 minutes before the start of the event to the participant teams registering on-spot.
* Debate topics will be disclosed 1 day before the start of the event to the participant teams registering online.

word-rush.description:
If you are interested in word games, then this event is exclusively for you.
 This event is going to test your love for word games along with your exposure to technical terms of various engineering disciplines.
word-rush.tagline: Hey there, It’s time for your brain to train!
rules: 1. A question bank with ten different word puzzles will be given to solve.
2. Participants will be given 10 mins to solve these questions.
This round consists of three different games,cumulative scores of these games will be taken into consideration for the final round.
1. Flash cards- It’s a memory game, only one member from each team can participate in this game.
2. Start music-It’s a musical dumb-C based on different words, two members from each team can participate in this game.
3. Club it-It’s a physical task where the participants need to run around and find their words to pair it with their team member’s word, two members
From each team can participate in this game.
1. This round is based on the famous television show – CONNEXIONS.
2. Picture clues will be provided and participants should guess theword.
. Based on the final score, judges will choose the winner.

paper-presentation.description: Believe it or not, Presentation unleashes Innovation and Ignites Inspiration ‘cause until and unless an idea is tested or questioned, it can’t be approved or accepted as an Innovation. We areoffering you a forum to showcase your presentation skills and in-depth knowledge of your research area in which your work will be weighed and evaluated by seasoned academic professionals.
paper-presentation.tagline: Every once in a while a new technology, an old problem and a big idea turn into an innovation
paper-presentation.notes:
1. Win a chance to get the best innovation award and best presenter award in addition to the first, second and third prizes.
 2. Your project on receiving the first place stands a chance to directly get selected to National Level Conference at SSN College of Engineering.
rules: Paper format:
1.	Articles should be in Microsoft Word format or PDF format.
2.	Articles should be written in single column format, using Times New Roman font, 12-point font size. Keep the layout of the text as simple as possible.
3.	Equations and formula should be readable, preferably written using equation.
4.	The affiliations of the author and co – author should be enclosed in the title page of the abstract.
• An abstract (150 to 300 words) of the topic of the topic is to be sent to the organizing team through mail ( paper4invente@gmail.com ) on or before 25th August,2019 (11:59 PM).
• The selection criteria will be based on the uniqueness of the topic.
• After selection of abstracts, the participant(s) should mail (paper4invente@gmail.com ) the camera-ready paper to the organizing team on 28th August,2019 (11:59 PM).
Final round:
1. The selected participants should report at the venue on 7th September 2019, with camera-ready paper (Hard copy) and a presentation (PPT) in a pen drive.
2. Duration: 10 minutes (7 mins for presentation and 3 mins for panel discussion)
3. Participants will be judged on their creativity, presentation skills and the format.
General Rules:
1.	The published paper and on – going projects are encouraged.
2.	Maximum Number of presenters: Three
3.	Cross College teams (Except SSN Students) are allowed.
4.	Participant(s) will be judged based on the unique creativity, presentation skills and format.
5.	The judge’s decision shall be final and binding.

qureka.description:
The Q! in Qureka is about Quickness, Quirks, and of course, the Quest for Quality Quizzing!
Department of Civil Engineering presents the most-sought after tech quizzing event of Invente over the years. We welcome you to be part of some mind-boggling and of course, fun brain-games. We have all the questions for your inquisition, but do you have the answers?
rules: 1. Participants must form a group of 2 members (Cross college teams are allowed).
2. Participants must carry their College ID card.
45 minutes test comprising of 30 technical and 10 non-technical questions will be given to each participant team and the top scores will be qualified to the next round.
Selected participants can undergo the rapid-fire round which comprises of 10 questions. The Team that answers the maximum number of consecutive questions will be declared as winners.

soltiare.description: Hey there, are you concerned about the many crises the world faces and do you have a solution for those crises? Here is “SOLVE-IT-aire”! - An event being launched at the INVENTE 4.0. This event is a platform for all the genius to showcase their quick-wit and problem solving skills. SOLVE-IT-aire promises to serve as a testimonial for your talent!
rules: Rules:
♦	Maximum 2 participants per team.
♦	Participants must bring their ID cards.
ROUND 1: Guess-it
1. Guess the technical word(one clue-one word)
2. Participants are given 60 seconds to find 5 words.
ROUND 2:  Pictionary
1. One member from the team should draw the given word and the other member should guess the word.
2. Cumulative scores of both the rounds will be taken into consideration for the final round.
ROUND 3: Problem - Solution
1. The participants will be given a problem related to civil engineering.
2.  4-5 minutes will be given to the participant to arrive at a solution for the given problem.
3. Economical and practical solutions are considered.
4. Judges will finalize the best solution.

dc-marvel-quiz.description: To the fans of Marvel and DC out there, brimming with the knowledge on comics and cinematic universe; An opportunity to present that expertise is here. Do you know all the characters and their back-stories? If so, then the trivia challenge is for you, give it a shot and see if you deserve the number one fan title.
rules: • A maximum of two members will be allowed in a team.
• Electronic devices are prohibited inside the venue.
• Answer sheets will be provided.
A slide containing questions will be shown to the participants and a sheet of paper will be given to write down the answers. Results will be published shortly after the completion of a session.

minute-to-win-it.description: Tired of all the technical events? Take off your thinking hats and come have fun with us. Now the time is set, seconds are running. What can u show us in a minute? Tasks are set, Beat the clock to win exciting prices. Come play the electrifying game of ‘Minute to win it’ with us.
rules: • Participants can form groups of maximum 3 people.
• There are 8 different games, each to be played for one minute.
• Participants should choose a minimum of 5 gamesto win prizes.
• Best 5 of all the games played wil be taken for evaluation.
• Players will be evaluated based on their performance and effectiveness.

music-tiles.description: How many times have song lyrics dominated your minds during the exam hall? Aren’t you the students who get pumped up right from the first second of a song. Let’s put all those talents into proper use and convince ourselves that the memory you’ve picked up over the years is totally worth it. Come play the moments, pause the memories, stop the mind and rewind the happiness.
rules: 1. Participants can form a group of maximum 2 people.
2. Event consists of 2 rounds
Round 1: Guess the song
1. Guess the song from the music played.
2. Participants will be given 60sec to find the song.
3. Winners will move to the 2nd round.
Round 2: Naduvula Konjam Pakatha Kaanom
1. Find the lyrics in between the song.
2. Winning team will be awarded with prices.

staad-pro.description: Are you a design enthusiast? Do you want to learn to work with the most widely used software in the construction industry for structural design and analysis? Here is a chance for you all to learn STAAD.Pro from the most renowned training institute, “CADD centre , PORUR”.

pin_it_up.venue:
Technical analysis laboratory 
Second floor, chemical engineering department
pin_it_up.description:
Hit the metaphorical bull's eye with our poster presentation event Pin It Up because if there were to only be two truths in this world, they are these:
Creativity is imaginative intelligence having fun and,
Design isn't some button on the Photoshop software but the turning of the gears in your brain to make the bells in them ding.
pin_it_up.notes: No materials or prior preparation required for the event
rules: Teams with members of 3 will be given the chance to illuminate their research work with a dash of aesthete in the form of A2 posters for the magical number of 10 minutes (7 minute presentation followed by 3 minute Q&A) - three is the undisputed, final answer to the ultimate question of the number of people needed to change a lightbulb, after all! Email your abstracts to: posterpresentationinvente@gmail.com

breaking_bad.description: In a perfectly brewed mix of joy and chemical engineering, the event Breaking Bad will be conducted in two rounds.
breaking_bad.tagline: Bored of preparing slides? This event is for you. Transform your research work into a colourful and illustrative poster adhering to the guidelines. Give a brief explanation about the content to our judges and stand a chance to win exciting prizes!.
rules: Round 1 gives you the opportunity to strap on your thinking hoods (chemical engineering pun intended) and engage in fun, enthralling puzzles and challenges stemming from the theme Centre of Life
Round 2 emulates a marathon-like, treasure hunt-esque environment to get your adrenaline pumping. You will be made to fight for (or fly away from, whatever lines with your vigour) the ultimate prize!

paper-presentation.description: The stage is up and ready to take your novel, ground-breaking ideas in this edition's Paper Presentation event, because it's understood that the world's best ideas are birthed not due to the invention of them, but more so their sharing
rules: Topics include:
• Waste water
• Environmental Engineering
• Material Technology
• Nanotechnology
• Process Optimisation
• Biochemical and Biotechnology
• Fuels and Petrochemicals
• Separation
•Maximum of 3 members per team
• World limit of abstract: 200
• Presentation time: 5-6 minutes
• Email the abstract to: pp2019invente4.0@gmail.com with the file name as the title of the paper and subject of the mail as Paper Presentation - {Participants' names}
Judges decision are final and binding.

autochem.description: Now's your chance to find out! In our flagship event AUTOCHEM, participants will be made to build their dream car using just their imagination, a bottle, a couple of caps and a chemical reaction that is, as the academics say, 'explosive'. Since we recognise that the best scientific discoveries weren't attained in a single try, we will give our participants 3 chances to get the formula just right to run their prospective spaceship. Time allotted is 30 minutes.
autochem.tagline: Ever wondered what happens when chemical reactions meet Formula One?
rules: The registered teams will report at the venue.
Two trials will be given to each team in this round.
The reactant chemicals will be provided by the organizers
The longest distance covered between the two trials will be considered.
A final trial will be given to selected team and the car must not travel more than the fixed distance.
The top 3 teams which achieve this will be the winners.

stranger_things.description: It is a well-known cliché that the odd one stands out - or does it? This new event demands its participants to use their (pseudo)psychokinesis abilities and channelize their inner Eleven to solve the mystery of the stranger thing amongst a set of seemingly normal pictures, all of which revolve around Chemical Engineering (don't worry, there's a bounty on its head, and a huge one at that!). So, Slurpee up and maybe emerge from a mysterious laboratory to win some exciting prizes!

chem-connextions.description: Are you an ardent fan of Vijay TV Connextion show? Do you love chemical engineering unit operations and general engineering? If yes to both, then you are “perfect” to take part in this event. Crack the pictures and answer the questions that follow and emerge as the winner.
rules: As a rendition of the popular Vijay TV show, this event, consisting of two rounds, will throw puzzles that revolve around Chemical Engineering at you for you to string together to create the perfect piece of metaphorical cloth! As the old saying goes: as the going gets tough, the tough get going - in the same vein, questions get progressively harder to test your true prowess in your knowledge of the technical world and your ability to connect the dots to make a tantalizing picture in the end.

shadow_of_truth.description: Are you someone who gets intrigued by mysteries? Can't get enough of Netflix's Mystery section, perhaps? Shadow of truth is the right place for you!
rules: The event, comprising of two rounds will first have a general aptitude test on Chemical Engineering and Chemistry topics that will act as an eliminator round (just like Sherlock talks to his clients to weed out the ones he does not find sufficiently interesting- oops, no offense..)

Second round will contain the dirty work - the studying of the crime scene, talking to suspects, insinuating enthralling theories and much more.. So, channel your inner Sherlock (bring a John Watson if you need him, of course), bring a maximum of a couple friends and solve these inimical crimes, crime scene- Chemical Engineering. Awaken your adept engineering minds to decipher the mystery!

house_of_cards.description: A picture speaks a thousand words, your teammates drawing them speaks thousand words, laughter, fun and exciting cash prizes. In the event House of Cards, our participants (teams of two) are required to attempt to bring to the light analytical Mr. Kevin Spacey to decipher some technical Chemical Engineering themed pictures (don't worry, not the sulphuric acid plant), and get a chance to make fun of your friend's drawing skills!

tiki_taka.description: Who said innovation and ideas must emerge only from the work you do? All it takes for you to be creative is a football. Tiki Taka at Invente allows you to make magic happen, through the beautiful game.
tiki_taka.notes: This event is not a typical chemical engineering event and is open to everyone as it requires very little chemical engineering knowledge.It is all about a peep into the corporate world
rules: Bring your 5 a side team, and beat the best to win exciting prizes! ( P.S.Teams can attack down the wings with Wiings). We're bringing the event, your turn to bring the talent!

mindhunter.description: In the hustle bustle of today’s mundane, boring world it is easy to forget to step into your inner child and allow them to run free. The event Mindhunter attempts to do just that for you using a series of games that will simulate happiness in you and make you glow. Come,participate, laugh and feel vicariously the sense of lush, green grass on your barefoot along with the sounds of birds chirping and the sunlight streaming your face.
mindhunter.notes: This event is not a typical chemical engineering event and is open to everyone as it requires very little chemical engineering knowledge.It is all about a peep into the corporate world

auto-quiz.description: Auto quiz is back with a bang and invites all the Auto maniacs! This quiz is all about Automobiles! Engage your grey cells and accelerate your answers as we have Cash Prizes and Certificates waiting for the winners! Display your Technical Chutzpah and conquer the title of Auto Wizard!
rules: This is a team event. Each team can consist maximum of 3 members. The event has two stages.
The prelims will be a written round, with 20 questions based on cars ,bikes, engines, current news about automobiles and additional racing car parts.
Five questions will be starred and will be used in the event of a tie breaker. The top eight teams will qualify to the final round.
The rules for the final round will be shared just before the round.
The decision of the quiz master will be final.

mechathlon.description: Prepare for the battle of brains! This event will test you on your core concepts. It will feature an interesting Quiz, Group discussion and an Interview. Win this battle and receive appreciation with Cash Prize and Certificate.
rules: Prelims:
●	All participants who have registered for the event will take a preliminary quiz consisting of 15 MCQs.
●	The allotted time is 20 min.
●	The preliminary quiz will be evaluated by volunteers and a merit list will be formed. In case of a tie, the starred questions will be used to break it.
●	The top 8 to 12 candidates will qualify for the next round, which is a Group Discussion (GD). The GD will be presided over by a professor.
Group Discussion:
●	It will either be a GD of 1 group with 8 members or 2 groups of 6 members each. The performance of participants in the GD will be evaluated by the faculty.
●	On a scale of 0 to 1, the weightage for the prelims quiz is 0.5, and the weightage for GD is 0.5.
●	A revised merit list will be drafted after the GD; the top 4 - 6 candidates will be eligible for the Final Interview.
Finals:
●	The panelists for the interview will be 3 faculty members (one each from the three broad areas of Manufacturing, Design and Thermal).
●	The panelists will unanimously decide the winner and the runners-up based on the performance in the interview.

robo-wars.description: Bring your powerful robots ready to battle as you’ll be pitted against other competing robots in one-on-one knockout matches where the aim is to push the opponent’s robot off the arena or immobilizing the other bot and scoring maximum points! Play to your strengths and strategies to win cash prizes!
robo-wars.notes:
Robot Control Requirements:

 If the bot is wired then the wire should remain slack under all circumstances during the competition. All the wires coming out of the bot should be stacked as a single unit. The wires should be properly insulated. Teams are suggested to use only rated wires such as ISI marked. Loose connections or improper wiring may lead to immediate disqualification even before the event. If the bot is controlled wirelessly, the bot must at least have a four-frequency remote control circuit or two dual control circuits which may be interchanged before the start of the race to avoid frequency interference with other teams. The case of any interference in the wireless systems will not be considered for rematch or results. Remote control systems from toys are allowed. Remote control systems available in the market may also be used. Battery and Power: The machine can be powered electrically only. Batteries must be sealed, immobilized- electrolyte types (such as Li-ion, NiCd, NiMH or dry cells). Working voltages must not exceed 24V DC (mean voltage) at any point in time. All power connections must be of an adequate grade and adequately insulated. Cables must be routed to minimize the chances of being cut. All efforts must be made to protect battery terminals from a direct short and causing a battery fire, failure to do so will cause immediate disqualification. Battery Eliminators are allowed and power source would be available at the venue for the eliminators.

Motors:

The robot should move as fast as possible around the arena with the help of motors. DC motors and stepper motors (12V-24V) can be used as per the design of bots. Note: We are not responsible for any damage that your bot may incur during the event.

Score Card: 

The score card is based upon the arena formulation. It is obvious that the robot with an extraordinary dynamism will succeed by thrusting out its combatant from the arena.
If a robot is pushed beyond the ring, the round ends and the other team is awarded the points.
The first team to win X rounds will get through to the Finals where X will be intimated on the day of the competition. Ultimately, if any of the combatants rolls out from the arena it will directly be eliminated from the War Field.
Criteria for triumph: A robot will be declared immobile if it cannot demonstrate linear motion of at least one inch in a timed period of 30 seconds. A bot with one side of its drive train disabled will not be counted out if it can demonstrate some degree of controlled movement. If both robots survive the 5 minutes, the robot with the higher scorecard points wins. The winner advances to the next round while the loser is eliminated from the tournament.

Pre-registration form: https://forms.gle/BHSsypYWex5T83ET8
rules: A team may consist of a maximum of 3 participants. Design and construct a wired or remote controlled bot capable of fighting in a one on one tournament.
General Rules:

The competition will be played on a knock-out basis consisting of 2 players at a time. The maximum duration of each round will be 5 minutes. Any team that is not ready at the time specified will be disqualified from the competition. The machine will be checked for safety before the competition. Any robot found unsafe to other participants and spectators will be disqualified. The organizers reserve the rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit. Change in rules, if any, will be highlighted on the website and notified to the registered teams. Violation of any rule will lead to disqualification. Judges’ decision shall be treated as final and binding on all.
Note: The bot should conform to the specified conditions.
Safety Rules:

Compliance with all event rules is mandatory. It is expected that competitors stay within the rules and procedures of their own accord and do not require constant policing. If you have a robot or weapon design that does not fit within the categories set forth in these rules or is in some way ambiguous or borderline, please contact the event organizers. All weapons must have a safety cover on any sharp edges
Dimensions and Fabrications:

The bot should fit in a 40 cm x 40 cm x 40 cm box with all mechanisms fully executing motions. Length and width is measured to the extremities of the Robot, i.e. includes any overhanging bodywork, weaponry or protrusions. The external device used to control the bot is not included in the size constraint. Maximum weight of the bot should not exceed 10 kgs. (including battery)
Mobility:

All bots must have easily visible and controlled mobility in order to compete. Movement of robot must be rolling of wheels only. Jumping and hopping is not allowed. Flying (using air foil, helium balloons, ornithopters, etc.) is not allowed.

mystery-event.description: It’s a fun event designed to make you have an amazing time.Partcipate to stand a chance to win exciting cash prizes and certificates!

project-exhibition.description: Unleash your engineering skills, creativity and intuition, and structure your ideas into reality. Project Presentation conducted by the Mechanical Department invites the doers! Send in your abstracts and the best projects will receive cash prizes and certificates!
project-exhibition.tagline: Science is about learning, Engineering is about doing
rules: General Rules:
●	Projects must fit in atleast one of the following three streams: Design, Thermal (includes projects related to alternate fuels and renewable energy) or Manufacturing & Production.
●	Each team can have a maximum of 4 members. Multiple teams are allowed from a college. Participants cannot be part of more than one team. A team cannot exhibit more than one project.
Prelims:
●	Every team must submit a two-page (A4 size) abstract of their project work

●	The report should include a brief write up on the following: project definition (problem statement or aim), methodology adopted (should provide basic information on calculations, fabrication method employed etc.) and conclusion (brief on the final outcome of the project)
●	Last date for submitting the preliminary report is 14th September 2018.
●	The report must be mailed to projectexpo@mech.ssn.edu.in
The qualified teams will present their project on the event day, in a space allocated to them.
Teams can use visual aids such as flex banners and charts for presentation.
(Maximum Size of Visual aids: 2x2 feet).
It is advised that the visual aids include the following topics:
●	Problem Definition
●	Design Calculation and Methodology
●	Fabrication Process and Method
●	Results and Discussion
Design and fabricated projects are most welcomed.

treasure-hunt.description: Looking to solve riddles? Want a boost of Adrenaline? If you’re looking to explore one of the most beautiful campus in the country or you just want to make some new friends – treasure hunt is what might catch your fancy.
rules: The total number of participants will be split into groups of four.
The teams will be expected to solve questions related to logic, decoding, odd one out and puzzles.
The top 6-8 teams will enter the next round
The teams entering the second round will be given another series of questions of sequential and suspecting (detection) type.
Only the top four teams will enter the final round
The teams will receive clues that will lead them to the place where their subsequent clue is hidden. The last clue leads the team to the final destination.
Each team will receive a total of ten clues in this round.
The teams emerging winners and runners-up will receive cash prize or a gift.

outdoor-gp.description: Get ready to show off your agile Nitro Car as it speeds through an exciting off-road obstacle course.Navigate through the blind spots, sharp turns and much more, as quickly as possible to win exciting Cash prizes and Certificate of Merit.
outdoor-gp.notes:
●	The track will be off-road with obstacles, slopes and tunnels. The width of the track will be revealed on spot. Only cars powered by internal combustion engines are allowed to compete.
●	Electric or solar powered cars will not be allowed under any circumstances.
●	Maximum allowable displacement for IC engines is 4.6 cc. Only nitro-based fuels or gasoline should be used in the cars.
●	For nitro-based fuels, the amount of nitro compounds in the mixture should not exceed 25%.
●	Fuel will not be provided by the organizers.
●	Teams must bring their own supplies. Only buggy type cars are allowed. The cars should fit in a 500mm x 400mm x300mm box. The antenna used for radio control is exempted from height restrictions.
●	Participants are advised to have multi-channel radio controllers to prevent frequency clashes.
●	FHSS Transmitters (Frequency Hop Spread Spectrum) are allowed.
●	Organizers will not be responsible for any interference in frequencies.
●	Contestants must bring sufficient number of batteries. Batteries will not be provided.
●	Both ready-to-run kit cars and custom fabricated cars are allowed to compete.

Pre-registration Form:  https://forms.gle/BHSsypYWex5T83ET8
rules: ●	Participants are required to submit an abstract containing the details of the parts fabricated to the email id mentioned below before the day of the event.
●	The abstract must contain photographs of the parts fabricated. All other technical specifications of the car must be included in the abstract.
●	Organizers have the right to stop a car from competing if it is found to be unsafe.
●	Time penalties for cars leaving the track are at the sole discretion of the organizers.
●	Details of the penalties will be revealed on the day of the event.
●	Participants will be given time for setting up their car before the commencement of the first round.
●	Each team gets one practice lap on the track.
●	Requests for additional trial runs on the actual track will not be entertained.
●	Organizers will not be responsible for accidental collisions during the head to head race.
●	Teams deliberately trying to obstruct another vehicle’s path will be subjected to disqualification.
●	The final decision rests with the organizers in this regard.
●	A pedestal will be provided for drivers to control their vehicles.
●	Drivers are prohibited from running around the track along with the car.
●	The track may contain challenging blind spots that are not clearly visible to the controller.
●	Only two track marshals per team will be allowed on the track (on the outside) to restore the cars leaving the track.
●	Participants will have to forfeit the competition if they face any technical issues with their vehicle.
●	Additional time will not be provided once the event starts.
●	Abstracts to be sent to: gnanaselvan16039@mech.ssn.edu.in

blitz-gp.description: BLITZ GP is an RC Car racing event held during INVENTE that tests the participant’s fabrication, driving and management skills. The event features a challenging timed obstacle course for the battery run RC car. An RC Car that conforms to the BLITZ GP standards is required for participation by each team. The three winners will receive exciting cash prizes and Certificate of Merit.
rules: A Team can have upto 4 members
Specifications:
●	Car Dimensions – 30 × 30 × 30 cm (L × B × H) Dimensions
●	12 V, 7A on – Board Battery
●	Track width is 44cm
Track:
●	Two separate (identical) tracks to compete in the preliminary round
●	Tracks will have sharp turns, obstacles and loops
●	In a case of a Knock-out both the teams will compete simultaneously and the quickest qualifies
●	Two separate tracks will be combined and extra obstacles will be added for the final round
General Instructions:
●	Bring your own Bot and tools.
●	Only on-board battery should be used.
●	Ready-made Bots and Lego kits are not allowed.
●	No components or Batteries will be provided.
●	Penalties will be specified on spot.
●	Same Bot should be used for all rounds.
●	It’s a time-based event.
●	The event coordinators will not be responsible for any damage caused to the bot.
●	Change of battery is allowed only once during the event.
●	The decision of Event head and coordinators will be final. Violation of rules will lead to disqualification.
●	1 Tech time out (2 minutes) will be given.
●	Resets will be decided on-spot.
●	Only 2 skips are allowed.
●	Wired and wireless bots are allowed.
●	Only two team members will be allowed on the track.
●	Depending upon the number of participants Knockout round will be conducted.

bottle-rocketrix.description: Flying has amused us for ages! And to fly better, requires meticulous engineering! Bottle Rocketrix aims to bring out the engineer in you. Apply the concepts of Aerodynamics and Center of Gravity to make your modified pressurised bottle fly the farthest.
rules: ●	Teams of 2-3 members are allowed.
●	A compressor, a launch-pad and water will be provided.
●	Maximum bottle capacity is 2500 ml (violation of which will result in disqualification).
●	Only single stage rockets are allowed, any modifications must be validated by the event head.
●	Information regarding the modifications must be intimated well in advance.
●	Pressure range is pre-determined (40-45 psi).
●	Time allotted to each team is 3 minutes.
●	Judgement will be based on the distance travelled by the rocket and the deviation from the fixed trajectory.
●	Use of sheet metal for the rockets is prohibited.
●	The decision of the event coordinators will be final.
● Top 5 from the best of 2 rounds will be selected and again evaluated.
● Top 3 will be given prizes accordingly.

paper-presentation.description:
Be a part of the research orbit and propel yourself to success! Get guidance and appreciation from
leading researchers! Strengthen your resume! Win exciting cash prizes! Papers under the following
categories are invited :
Thermal
Design
Manufacturing
rules: Max. No. of members per team: 3
Presentation time limit: 7 minutes
Last date for Submission of abstract and full paper:  14 September, 2018.
The abstract is to be mailed to the email address: paperppt@mech.ssn.edu.in
Subject in the e-mail: Paper Presentation Abstract.

line-follower.description: The clock is ticking! Beat the clock to reach the centre. The fastest bot with the smartest algorithm can only follow the time to reach the epicentre and win against the competing bots. Be ready for a race against time at this Invente and win prizes.
rules: BEAT THE TRACK
A team can consist maximum of 4 members.
Students from different educational institutes can form a team.
The line to be traced (black line) is of 30mm in width.
The potential difference between any two points in the bot must not exceed 12V .
The bot must be powered by on-board batteries.
The maximum dimensions of the bot should be 25cm x 25cm x 20cm.
Ready-made bots are strictly prohibited. (Readymade chassis are allowed)
All components should be brought by the participants.
Judge's decision will be final and any further arguments with the judges will be penalized.
Main objective is to traverse the track as quickly as possible.
Best of 2 tries will be considered.
Participants can adjust their sensors and gains after the first run.
Track will have straight lines, curves, markers, loops, gaps and turns (90 degree, acute and obtuse).
Top 6 teams qualify for the next round.
Beat the CLOCK
The track will be a clock.
Main objective is to travel in the clock from the start point to the stop point in the path which will be specified by the hour and minute hand of the clock.
Best of 2 tries will be considered.
Track will have straight lines, curves, markers, loops, gaps and turns (90 degree, acute and obtuse).
In case of a tie, winners will be decided based on the time taken to complete the maximum path.
JUDGES DECISION IS FINAL.

bridge-balancio.description: Are you the kind of person who knows how to balance your life correctly? ​“Balance the bridge without weight”​. Then this event is aimed for you. Come and show your skills by balancing the bridges that will be given to you and win some exciting prizes!
rules: A Team of maximum 3 members are allowed to participate.
First round is either prelims or logic circuit designing according to the participant choice.
Maximum of half an hour is given to them in the first round.
The top 5 teams are called for the finals.
For the final round, the participants are provided with a partial diagram of the bridge, which each team has to identify and fill in the remaining parts of the bridge and balance it theoretically.

d-sim.description: Think binary!! Are you the kind of person who speaks binary? Do you like to play around with logic gates? Are you enlightened by the​ HIGH​s and​ LOW​s of life? Here we are with the best opportunity to fire up your neurons. Fasten your seat belts , cause the ride is gonna be an adventurous ONE.
rules: Consists of 15 MCQ’s.
Modelling logic circuits for given output equations
Reducing logical equations (using simulation) ​OR ​debugging logical circuit (with constraints in number of elements and wire connections).
Design logical simulation for the given problem statement.
Maximum participants in a team : 2

electronic-maze.description: Ever watched Maze Runner movie or played maze game on a computer? Wanna experience something similar? Discover new paths and win exciting prizes!!!
rules: Maximum 3 members in a team.
No electronic gadgets.
Multiple choice questions. Answer some basic questions on electronics and aptitude. Simple!!
​Navigate and find your way
Also conquer obstacles in your path. Challenging enough?? On encountering an obstacle, either solve the question and move forward or take an alternate route.

pandora-box.description: Like how the Pandora Box contains the different sins, our box will have different sets of components. Unleash the components within to overcome the gruelling challenges and get rewarded for your innovative ideas.
rules: There will be two rounds.
A team of maximum 4 members can participate in the event.
The top 3 teams will be awarded cash prizes.
Judges decision is final.
The first round will be a preliminary round which consists of 15 MCQ type questions and 2 coding questions based on Electronics and Arduino.
A maximum time limit of 30 minutes will be provided for each team to complete the preliminary round.
The 5 top scoring teams in this round will advance to the final round.
The selected teams are allowed to bring their Arduinos and laptops if they so desire; nevertheless, they will be provided for the final round.
Each team will be given 100 points from which the teams have to choose the components in the box worth the given points.
The teams have to interface the selected components with Arduino and come up with an innovative solution with the least points used.
The maximum time given is 90 minutes.
If any 3 teams of 5 manage to come up with the solution within the stipulated time, then they will be declared winners.

project-display.description: Are you looking for a platform to showcase your invention? Do you have a project that is a wonder and will make heads turn in admiration? Then, PROJECT DISPLAY is the right platform for you. This is your opportunity to steal the spotlight and make some good money! Flaunt your project.
rules: A team can consist of a maximum of 4 members.
The project must be within the realm of Electrical and Electronics engineering.
Must be original.
Should have a legitimate title. Titles copied from existing projects will not be allowed.
Must be a ​working model​.
Required components are to be brought by the participants. No components will be provided.
Registration must be done online.
Late entries will not be entertained.
An abstract of around 150 words with an apt project title is to be sent as a pdf attachment to the mail.
The mail must consist of the following details of each team member: Name, Phone number, email ID, College name
Abstracts must be mailed to ​projectdisplay2k19@gmail.com
The abstracts will be scrutinised by a panel and the shortlisted teams will be notified.
The working model is to be displayed during Invente 2019.
Each project will be judged by a panel of experienced judges.
The decision of the judges will be final.

paper-presentation.description: What makes innovative thinking happen? We think it’s really a mindset. Let your mind write the paper, not your hand.
rules: The participants should send their papers in IEEE format without exceeding 8 pages.
The papers should be sent to the mail id: invente2019paperpresentation@gmail.com​.
The papers will be evaluated and the selected teams will be intimated through mail.
The selected teams should bring the soft copy of the paper and powerpoint presentation in the pen drive for presenting on the day of the event.
The presentation time should not exceed the length of 10 minutes.
The paper will be judged based on the criteria like plagiarism, style of writing, presentation and discussion.

ipl-bidding.description: It’s time to recover from WC hangover and get into our IPL madness. Who wants to Don the ​Yellove​ Jersey? Is cricket your Jaan? Wanna lift your first cup without choking? Let’s don’t mess it up being unpredictable. This season let’s see who’s gonna win it with the perfect squad. The Lions vs The Paltans. Srini Mama vs Ambani. And to be honest, RCB vs Ashish Nehra. Make your favorite teams win by bidding the right players. Be there, participate and win exciting prizes this September.
rules: Online quiz will be conducted for two days. At the end of each day one winner will be chosen so two teams will be selected for the final round directly from the online quiz.
The Online quiz consists of questions from IPL and some important international matches. The online quiz link will be active only for two hours, the date and timing will be announced soon.
Participants have to finish the online quiz before the timer ends.
Hit it in the crowd. Answer the saucy quiz and puzzles and get into the Final round.
Bid it cheap and watch them weep. Bid your favorite players and win the game with a perfect squad.

tentkotta.description: IN A SYMPOSIUM FILLED WITH TECHNICAL EVENTS, TENTKOTTA COMES ACROSS AS THE TEA BREAK OF INVENTE. IF YOU ARE A VETERAN OF MOVIES, OR EVEN JUST A CASUAL COMPETITOR, THIS EVENT IS FOR YOU! MOVIE BASED BANTS, SCENES, OR JUST SONG LYRICS. THIS IS ALL YOU NEED TO COMPETE IN THIS TWO DAY EVENT.
rules: ​The first round of the new cine-based event, Tentkotta is MCQs and Puzzles of anything related to movies
Only 2 or 3 members per team
No usage of mobile phones or other devices during the event
The final round of the event consists of a variety of competitions
Dumb Charades​: 1. Be the dumb one 2. Act out the title 3. Profit.
Connections​: Others may think these are a random arrangement of pictures, but this could be your key to winning!
Mono act​: Showcase your acting skills by acting out two characters at the same time to get the win!
Lyrics Finder​: Been memorizing lyrics instead of studying for the semesters? This stage is yours to own!

tech-quiz.description: At Invente 4.0, see if you can win one piece, the treasure left by the king of the pirate. But behold you are not alone in the quest and will have to compete with fellow pirate. Be careful though the battle is not physical but one of technological knowledge. Enter if you dare.
rules: Maximum 3 per team
No electronic devices are allowed during the event
Multiple choice questions. You will have to face 20 questions in the domain of electrical and electronics and mathematics.
This round is split up into two:
The round will have two set of questions. One from your field of choice and the other will be decided by chances.
Next will be the buzzer round.

e-vehicles-and-hybrid-vehicles-workshop.displayName: E- Vehicles and Hybrid Vehicles Workshop
e-vehicles-and-hybrid-vehicles-workshop.description: It's almost 2020! Yes, we still aren't in the stone age to travel in petrol and diesel engine driven vehicles...the time has come to step up to build a sustainable and renewable future for the forthcoming generations. And the next big thing which is happening in and around us is the “Electric Revolution in the Automobile sector”. Yes.... An electric revolution in the automobile sector. Interested? Want to know about it? Here is the best platform to enlighten your minds. Presenting you ​Toyota Kirloskar Motors – the automobile giants who are fast accelerating in the market of Hybrid Vehicles and E- Vehicles. Toyota in association with ​Invente 4.0 is staging a talk on the technological advancements and the technical and industrial aspects required for the field of E-Vehicles and Hybrid Vehicles​ here in SSN College of Engineering. Grab your seats, as this is one opportunity where you can directly come across the Giants in person. Get ready to explore the infinity, be there at the ​Justice Pratap Singh Auditorium​ in ​SSN College of Engineering​. On spot registrations are also available.
e-vehicles-and-hybrid-vehicles-workshop.eventname: E- Vehicles and Hybrid Vehicles Workshop

paper-presentation.description: Paper Presentation is one of the most iconic events in INVENTE 4.0. It is here that students have a great platform to showcase their innovative ideas that could lead to great revolutions in technology.
paper-presentation.tagline: The people who think they are crazy enough to change the things in the world are the ones who do it.
rules: Teams will have to describe their ideas in a small abstract not more than 250 words. Based on the abstracts sent, teams will get shortlisted to the next round.
Teams have to send their abstract in pdf format to the mail paperpresentation.ece.ssn@gmail.com on or before the stipulated dates with the subject being INVENTE4.0 – Paper Presentation Abstract.

Teams selected in Round 1 must send their papers in pdf format to the mail paperpresentation.ece.ssn@gmail.com on or before the stipulated dates with the subject being INVENTE4.0 – Paper Presentation Full Paper.
The body of the mail should contain details of the team members such as participant’s name, department, college, phone number and e-mail address.
Teams will have to bring hard copies of the abstract and full paper on the day of presentation. Each team would be given a time span of 10 minutes to explain their ideas.
The judges’ decisions shall be binding and final.
IMPORTANT DATES:
Last date for submission of abstract: 15.08.2019
Intimation of acceptance of abstract: 18.08.2019
Last date for submission of paper:01.09.2019
Intimation of acceptance of paper: 03.09.2019

Teams shortlisted in the previous round will have to send in the full paper clearly explaining the project idea. Based on the papers sent, teams will get shortlisted to present the paper on the day of the event.

think-d.venue:
Prelims:
2A, First Floor, Annexure Block, Dept. of ECE
Finals:
Microprocessor & Microcontroller Lab, Dept. of ECE
think-d.description: Design is a dangerously obscure term. Especially in the Age of Design in which “good design” mark might be a highway to success for any product and “bad design” may doom anything.Diving deep into the nature of design can give us some kind of clear view for the matter, so here comes the perfect chance for you to showcase your creativity here at INVENTE.There are three round in think D
think-d.notes: Participants are not required to have the knowledge to use photoshop or illustrator.We make up our mark purely based on your creativity
rules: The participants are given with MCQ paper test with a design thinking ideate. The questions are based on the design of things they daily use and visualize on there daily basis, To observe there grasping knowledge.

In round two there will be a same set of tools and images given to everyone and the participants are made to use Adobe photoshop to correct the image and remove the noise and are made to find the correct product identification.
It is about poster design and logo design using Adobe illustrator where the raw picture and sub materials will be given by us with a statement of purpose.

solder-it.description: There are some who Short-circuit their electronics and run away when the tiniest of shocks hit them and there are those who break and understand what really happened. Those who are passionate about electronics, whose dreams are filled with resistors and capacitors forming a network as beautiful as that of a spider. If you belong to this rare breed of dreamers, then you are in for a treat. Come and join us at “SOLDER IT” @ INVENTE and compete with others who are equally passionate in soldering as you are and surprise us all with all the skills that you possess.
solder-it.tagline: Wish to bond Electronics with electronics !
rules: A paper pen test with questions distributed across sections - puzzles, electronics, programming.
Duration – 30 minutes.

Teams will be shortlisted based on the paper pen test and will be given the necessary items such as soldering rod, lead, flux,  transistors etc. You will given a circuit description that you have to solve and solder the components according to the circuit layout you inferred.
You will be scored on how well and neat your circuit is soldered and implemented with points for improvisation as well!!

make-a-thon.description:
Hear Hear Hear!!Yes you! Are you the one among many who always wanted to make a
block of code come to life? Well the magic word is MATLAB ,C++, Python etc .How about we tell you that you will get actually rewarded for the coding? Sounds exciting right? Do you
wanna show us who is the BOSS here? Just jump a few hurdles and the Holy Grail(pun not
intended) is yours .Lets visualize the world together in a new way, with chef de-ouvre software of modeling –MAKE-a-THON (CODING BOSS)not like ( BIGG BOSS) .Can’t wait to meet you all #invente3.0 #BeaCodeking!!
rules: 1)The first round is pen and paper round which will consist questions of MCQ type from basic
programming and MATLAB, C ,C++,python coding, with elimination every 10 minutes based on
number of questions answered correctly.
Team will be given 45 mins​ to solve the questions
2)Top performing teams will be shortlisted to the next rounds based on the points they
score in this round.
3)In case of tie between teams, starred questions will be used to eliminate teams.
Matlab coding ,python,c++ tasks like using GUI, Simulink etc using MATLAB , PYcharm software
based on common usages in programming.(1Hr)

enigma.description: You are up against a serial killer who has confined you to shackles in a techno-savvy environment filled with riddles. Race against the clock to crack the code and escape from them before it’s too late!
enigma.notes: (A team can consist of maximum of 3 people)
rules: The test consists of 20 questions. 10 non-technical questions based on general aptitude and mathematics with 1 pt each. 5 medium difficulty technical questions based on generalengineering concepts with 2 pts each. 5 extreme difficulty technical questions that tests the application skills of the participants with 4 pts each.
Maximum marks: 40
Stipulated time: 30 mins

The participants will be given a set of puzzles that consists of a secret code. The participants need to decode the message and then build a circuit to detect and verify it. The winner will be selected based on time management and efficiency of the circuit.

run-out.tagline: Take a shot, not for the faint-hearted
rules: Round 1(prelims) :cricket quiz(pen and paper)

Round 2: ( shortlisted 4 teams ) will be consist of 3 matches ( 2 SF and a Final) --Each match will consist of 2 innings, where the 2 teams will have to bat as well as field. --the two players from the fielding team has to stand near the stumps in the strikers end and non-strikers end and the batting team will run between the wickets while the fielding team tries to answer the quiz and run the batsman out(runs run by the batting team is their score)...the more time the fielding team takes to finish each round of answers, the more runs the opposite team scores by running between the wickets. -- a innings will consist of 6 ball...each ball will have 3 questions which has to be answered alternatively by the fielder at the striker and non-striker end individually. Each fielder has to answer his question and throw the ball to the other end, where his teammate will catch the ball and then answer his question. The fielding team has to answer 3 questions before trying to run out the opposite team. This happens for 6 balls. The total runs run by the batting team is their points. -- both the teams switch their role for their second innings, the batting team tries to chase down the target. --the winning team goes to the finals... (The quiz questions in the match can be replaced by word building(cricket related terms) to make it more fun)

e-treasure-hunt.description: This is basically a treasure hunt game with slight technical changes as per our ece dept. There are 3 rounds in this game.
rules: 1st round:
Basic MCQ questions related to circuits.

The teams that qualify the first round will be given a clue which leads to a sequence of clues .Once they solve a single clue they will get a piece of the puzzle (circuit) which is basically a component of the circuit and the place where the next clue can be found and this moves on until they find all the pieces.
The first three teams which find the clues move to the next round
From the given components,the teams need to build a set of circuits that we give to them in minimum possible time

junkyard-jumble.description:
What would you do if you had a good imagination on one hand and junk on the other? Put your hands together and you’ll have what, according to Edison, is sufficient to INVENT! Junkyard Jumble is an event that will put your engineering skills to test by building something out of “supposedly” nothing! 
Remember, “It’s not about ideas, it’s about making ideas HAPPEN”. May the best innovation win!
rules: The first round is a written test that is comprised of aptitude, fundamental engineering (Electronics, Coding etc) and also some riddles to test the participants’ problem solving ability. Do not take round 1 lightly, for the points you score in this round can come to your rescue in round 2 as well.
SPIN THE WHEEL: The contestants will be required to spin a wheel that contains the following options:
Advanced electronics
Digital electronics
Communication systems
Mechanical contraptions

The contestants will be handed a “mystery box” that contains assorted components from each of these domains (which they’ll be choosing by spinning the wheel), and they’ll be given three hours to come build something from a seemingly random collection of things.
Not too familiar with electronics? Worry not! Pick contraptions with the extra points you bagged in round 1!
Remember, “It’s not about ideas, it’s about making ideas HAPPEN”. May the best innovation win!
RULES:
Teams must comprise of 2-3 members.
Additional components will be provided if necessary, depending on the points secured in round 1.
Teams are allowed to use the internet for ideas in the second round, all we’re looking for is a working model and possible inventions!

triwizard-tournament.description:
TRIWIZARD TOURNAMENT:
  	"....It is my very great pleasure to inform you that the Triwizard Tournament will be taking place at SSN (Nope! not Hogwarts) this year" - Albus Dumbledore?
A team comprising of 2-3 members can be formed.
Round-1:
This round consists of puzzles to test your creativity and your problem solving ability, a total of 20 questions. All the teams that clear the minimum requirement will move on to the next round.
Round-2:
 JAM is an all round event that is all about the control of the mind over the mouth. One of the team members is supposed to talk based on a technical situation put forth. The team will be selected for the next round based  on the performance of the participant representing the team.
Round-3:
The final round is totally based on how you persuade others in selling the technical idea/model (choice of your own) and convince the team on investing on your idea. The team should come up with creative ways to sell their idea.
rules: Round-1:
This round consists of puzzles to test your creativity and your problem solving ability, a total of 20 questions. All the teams that clear the minimum requirement will move on to the next round.

JAM is an all round event that is all about the control of the mind over the mouth. One of the team members is supposed to talk based on a technical situation put forth. The team will be selected for the next round based  on the performance of the participant representing the team.

The final round is totally based on how you persuade others in selling the technical idea/model (choice of your own) and convince the team on investing on your idea. The team should come up with creative ways to sell their idea.

trump_the_aces.description: Luck can determine the winner but knowledge can beat all odds. “Trump the Ace” is a fun technical event where the individuals’ holistic knowledge of engineering is tested.
rules: Teams will be given a chance to pick a card from the deck available. Based on the card that has been picked, they will be given a set of questions in different engineering and general topics which they have to answer to score points. If the team picks an ace card, the team stands a greater chance to boost their points by choosing to answer bonus questions from the topic of their interest. Based on the teams' scores in the first round, a certain number of teams will be qualified for the second round.

The second round is an application-oriented one. In this round, each qualified team will be tested on their conceptual and analytical skills. The teams will have to draw a card once again. Based on the card obtained, they will be presented with different engineering-related situations. If the card is an ace, the teams can boost their score by choosing to solve a situation given to any other team. If the team pointed to, has picked a face card, it can pass a question of its own choice. The teams have to analyze the given situations and come up with ideas to solve the issues in the situation. All the teams are expected to deliver their solutions in front of other teams and the organizers. Analyzing their ideas and their excellence in delivering the idea, a winner and runner will be chosen. In order to make the event more enjoyable and interactive,other rules will be strategized.

biogonize.description:
Totally 3 rounds.
1.Takku takku takkunu- a fast video clip of pictures related to engineering and u have to identify them.
2 Innovation out of waste- making models out of miscellaneous items.
3.Oru kadha solta sir-Should create a story with the given biological words.
And a team of 2 should participate
biogonize.tagline: It's not just your brains that need to play!
rules: Fast video will be played and u have to identify the things in that video.The one who find maximum things wins the game
U will be given few points using that points u should buy waste material and to make model out of that waste
Should form a story using the given biomedical words

scintelligence-3.0.timing:
Prelims 
Round 1 :9:00 to 10:00 am

Semi finals
Round 2 : 10:00 to 11:00 am
Round 3 : 11:00 to 12:00 am

Finals
Round 4 : 1:00 to 2:00 pm
Round 5 : 2:00 to 3:00 pm

Prize distribution : 3:00 to 3:30 pm
scintelligence-3.0.description:
Leggo again!!!!!Expose The scrumdelicious… The hard earned thirst!!
Because engineering is complicated enough, we make it much more complicated. Come as good as it gets! To the resurging SCINTELLIGENCE 3.0 bundled up with newer better and bigger rounds.

Prelims:
1) Bounce OFF.

Sem finals:
1) Tap to cap.
2) Where do i kept my bits?

Finals
1) Cap yourself Sherlock.
2) Wolf of the wall street.
scintelligence-3.0.tagline: Tighten!! the power is on your side and Don’t leave the house without prize.
rules: Bounce OFF!
Forget pinballs, for we now have bin and balls!
Time duration: 30mins
Scoring: 2pts / answer.
Tap to cup
Toss the spoon really soon, get the clue to edge over the crew.
Time duration: 30mins
Scoring: 2pts / answer
Where do I kept my bit?
There’s many a slip twixt the cup and the lip…
Go for it and tap into the pit!
Time duration: 30mins
Scoring: 2pts / answer
Cap yourself sherlock
To a great mind, nothing is little. Come! Eliminate the impossible. Let’s see who is the Sherlock of this new generation.
Time duration: 30mins
Scoring: 5pts / answer
Wolf of the wall street
“It’s a business, keep your emotions at the doors!”
Are you the wolf? Show us how loud you can howl!
Time duration: 30mins
Scoring: share based.

tellurians.description: Explore, learn and have fun by flying to various planets and decipher the various zestful and intriguing quizzes and puzzles to complete your mission.
rules: A TEAM CAN CONSIST OF 2-4 MEMBERS!!
Round I: Planet Gliese
Quiz-o-mania: The participants should answer a set of technical and non-technical questions within the stipulated time.
The teams who are qualified will be informed and requested to be present for the next rounds which will be held on Day 2.
Round II: Planet Fye
94%: The goal of “94%” is to find the top 94% of the given answers to a specific question. There are many possible answers to each question, but the trick is to find the most popular answers.
Logo Quiz: A description of a company or a product will be given; the participants should find the logo.
Connexions: A total of four pictures will be given and each picture will be linked to each other, the participants should guess the answer.
4 teams will be selected based on the points they received and qualified for the final round.
Round III: Planet Kepler
Who am I? : Clues will be given and the participants have to find the answer.

Treasure Hunt: Based on the clues from “Who am I?”, the participants will further be given more clues to reach various spots and find a key to unlock the box in the last spot which contains the puzzle which needs to be solved.

paper-presentation.description: Express your enthusiasm for the biomedical field by presenting your innovations and ideas.
rules: Abstracts should be sent by 10th September

matalino.venue: Biomedical department, 1st Floor, LS 04 ( final year class room)
matalino.description:
4 rounds, 2 members per team
1.high on volume ( find the word amidst the high volume) 
2.fire the five (Q&A) 
3.music trivia ( musical chair kindof thing) 
4.mathoscience ( equation solving and Bio related Q&A)
rules: Round1:High on volume!
Earphones are provided to one member. List of words are given to another. The one with earphones have to find the words amidst the high music..Time limit:2min.
Round2:Fire the five!!
Five questions are given. They have to find that five answers. The first letter of the five answers gives the main answer. Time limit:5min
Round3:Music Trivia
Similar to musical chair.. Questions are displayed in projector.Answers are pasted on chairs.The team member have to find out answer and sit on the correct chair.
Round4:Mathoscience

An equation is given. They have to solve the equation and find the number. They have to run to that numbered bench..One technical question will be given there.They have to find answer and again convert it into number.

demaxxon.description: Demaxxon is full of interesting challenges and innovative mind always look up for the challenges,which aids in understanding the secrets of technology.
demaxxon.tagline: Try and Fail but don't Fail to Try
rules: Choose one among the collection of domains and answer for that questions duration 1 hour.
Face the technical as well as non technical questions and challenge with the opposite team duration 2 hours.
Find maximum number of things in a technical/non technical video duration 1hour.

hospital-hustle.description: A virtual money game where the ultimate goal is to build and keep the hospital alive even when the spurious accidents do the rounds.  Design your very own hospital, tweak every detail and show us that you own all the tricks of the business. Become an aspiring manager, a successful planner and an ace practioner all at the same time.
hospital-hustle.tagline: Play or bid to keep your stakes high to build your own hospital
hospital-hustle.prize: Winner - Rs 3500 First Runner up - Rs 2000 Second Runner up - RS 1500
rules: 1. A hustle team of minimum 3 and maximum 5 members will be allocated a base deposit of 50000 virtual bucks and a manual listing the details of machines/equipments available in the hospital will be given.
2. Teams will have to auction to buy certain equipments and raw materials to start designing a particular department of the hospital.

1. The price of the raw materials will inflate and deflate. Some spurious accidents will be posted on the teams and the teams will have to overcome them by earning more and more bucks either by selling their products and shares or by playing dare games.
2. By the end of the second round, only the top five teams with higher number of bucks will be selected for the final showdown.

Fnal showdown is fun and frolic. Your stakes might taste profit or might meet accident. It all depends on how well you manage shares and how artistic is your design in terms of planning. The team that manages to function the hospital and is able to maintain good figure shares with the administration wins!

sapiens-washout.description: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them, so shoe yourself and spruce up to show your skills and win exciting prizes
rules: Rules
1.Finish within the clock to prove your skills .
2.Solo or Team based depending upon the task.

misterioso.tagline: Unlocking mysteries at the speed of thought!
rules: Teams of 2 or 3 will be formed on random basis.
Each team will qualify for the subsequent round by enacting the answers to a set of questions in the format of charades
Sometimes the simplest of concepts can be tricky and nerve wracking to answer.
The second round will be a lightning quiz round where teams will be judged on the basis of their speed to answer questions in a short span of time.
Theme Round:
Props and items for the selected theme will be displayed.
Shortlisted teams will be asked a set of questions pertaining to the theme.
A correct answer will enable them to secure the props and items.
The team with the maximum props and items will be declared as the Winner.

pubg-mobile-tournament.tagline: Do you have what it takes to be the last man standing? Come battle it out with us at SSNCE!
pubg-mobile-tournament.notes: Pre-Register for the tournament through the above link.
rules: Top 5 teams will be selected from 4 games
A bonus round will be held(Arcade matches) to select wild card entries
The final Classic TPP squad game will decide the winner

augmented-reality-and-virtual-reality.description:
• Ever dreamt of becoming a game engineer?! Have an ardent fervor for deploying your own gaming  scenes? Here is an ultimate chance to develop and deploy Virtual Reality games/any varied platform.This workshop basically works on areas of designing and development of an application related to augmented reality and virtual reality.
• The workshop is handled by professionals from the Digital Meridian.
• The session starts at eight thirty and ends by three in the evening.
• There are refreshments and by twelve we will break for lunch, soon the session resumes within forty five minutes.
• The first one hour of the workshop is an introduction to AR, VR & MR.
• For the next one hour the various fundamentals of VR are explained.
• After which the immersive app called "phobia" in VR app development using the unity Google unityand VR,c# begins.
• You can also learn on how to use a VR camera inside UNITY, implementing head rotation, sensors used in VR, lighting, creating a GUI for VR applications and what are all the game objects, materials, transformations and animations using scripting and c#.
• Then the track turns to interactive student profile generation in AR using SDK's software platform and devices. Then AR APP development is done using VUFORIA & UNITY.
• The workshop ends with advanced level of app development using c# scripting.
• The other technologies being used are HTC vive, Microsoft hololens.
augmented-reality-and-virtual-reality.tagline: Simulate and experience an immersive virtual environment that transcends the physical reality
